entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Alamosa County through 215 PM MDT... SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:57PM MDT until June 19 at 2:15PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTH CENTRAL MONTROSE COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 200 PM MDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...INCREASED FIRE DANGER IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... Relative humidity values of 25 percent or lower have developed this afternoon in northeast Georgia and these will persist until early evening. With brush and other fuels very dry, and air temperatures in the mid 80s, elevated fire danger is occurring despite the fairly light winds.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 3:28AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON AND EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF NORTHWEST, EAST CENTRAL, AND EAST GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:42PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Park County through 215 PM MDT... At 141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Powell, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 18 at 3:39PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: Very warm temperatures will continue through the weekend. These temperatures, combined with windy conditions, will result in significant high-mountain snowmelt once again. It is likely most small streams and creeks, and possibly some main stem rivers, will likely reach high levels again. Currently only bankfull conditions (Action Stage) to minor low-land flooding (Minor Stage Flooding) is
entry.cap:areaDesc: Big Horn; Fremont; Hot Springs; Johnson; Park; Teton; Washakie
